result.execSummary:
The defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Juan Antonio Larriuz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Juan Antonio Larriuz was found guilty of OWI (2nd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Juan Antonio Larriuz was found guilty of Endangering Safety by use of Dangerous Weapon While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

*Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.
Concurrent with: With any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment ONLY.  Court STAYED the sentence to April 20, 2016 by 5pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Antonio Larriuz

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Denying Request for Ignition Interlock exemption, signed and filed.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, the motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Jean Kies, Br. 45, for review. mag
Filed, Letter Requesting IID Exemption

Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.    Student Intern Carl Knepel under the supervision of Assistant District Attorney Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: LM  
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Count 1
Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence with credit for 1 day time served.  Huber privileges for work and treatment ONLY.  Court STAYED the sentence to April 20, 2016 by 5pm.  Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $700 plus all mandatory costs, penalties, surcharges, and $50.00 ignition interlock surcharge by April 12, 2017.  Failure to pay will result in an immediate entry of a civil judgment ordered by the court.  Court ordered AODA assessment and Driver's Safety Plan.  Defendant to cooperate with any treatment recommended.  Court ordered defendant's driving privileges revoked for a period of 2 years.    Court orders defendant restricted to operation of vehicles equipped with an ignition interlock device for 18 months to commence upon eligibility to reinstate license.  

As to count 3   
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 60 days at the House of Corrections with 1 days credit CONCURRENT to count 1 and to any other sentence. Huber privileges for work and treatment ONLY.
Court ordered the defendant pay all court costs, fees, and surcharges by April 12, 2017.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan
Sentencing Referral Form

CASE HEARD IN BRANCH 21 FOR BRANCH 31.  Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Jenny Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  vk  As to Counts 1 & 3:    Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, jury instructions and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  As to Count 2:  By operation of law and on motion of the State Court dismissed the count.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 31.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 12, 2016 at 08:30 am.
-CASE SPUN TO BRANCH 21 (RESERVED BRANCH) FOR BRANCH 31 (HONORABLE JUDGE RIFELJ'S COURT).   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for motion hearing, defense counsel withdrew motion. For reasons stated on the record,   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Case calendared for motion hearing.
Joint request for adjournment.  Defense needs additional discovery from state.  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 36.  All parties are notified that effective 12-01-15 this case will be assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 31, in Room 615 of the Courthouse.  Motion hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 08:30 am.
-State's Response To Defendant's Motion To Suppress from Assistant District Attorney Brittany Kachingwe; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Filed, Notice Of Motion And Defendant's Motion To Suppress Evidence

Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Defense counsel requests motion hearing.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by October 6, 2015. State's response: October 30, 2015.  Case is adjourned for Motion hearing, in Branch 37.  Motion hearing scheduled for November 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Defense counsel has received discovery and offer, additional time to review with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Bail Refund Check Packet

Court ordered the remainder of the cash bail be returned to the remitter.
Absolute sobriety.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
No driving without a valid license.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Juan Antonio Larriuz in court with attorney Mark A. Pecora.   Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
AODA form placed in file
